content:
Diagnosis:
Hepatocellular carcinoma, BCLC stage B
Diagnosed March 2024 following investigation of deranged liver function

Previous medical history:
Child-Pugh A cirrhosis secondary to NAFLD
Type 2 diabetes
Hypertension

Current medications:
Metformin
Amlodipine

Current situation:
Cycle 2 TACE completed 15 April 2024

Investigations:
MRI liver 12 April 2024 - partial response with 40% reduction in enhancement of target lesions in segments 5/6
AFP decreased from 3500 to 1200
Liver function remains stable

I reviewed [redacted name] today following his second TACE procedure. He has recovered well with only mild post-embolization syndrome that resolved within 48 hours. His appetite has improved and weight is stable. Performance status remains 0. Examination shows no new concerns.

The plan is to proceed with cycle 3 TACE in 6 weeks time. We will arrange a progress MRI liver and AFP prior to next treatment. Follow up appointment has been scheduled for 4 weeks.

cancer_timeline.value: MRI liver shows 40% reduction in enhancement of target lesions in segments 5/6

patient_facts.value: Child-Pugh A cirrhosis secondary to NAFLD

status_updates.value: HCC responding well to TACE with radiological partial response and falling AFP. Minor post-procedure symptoms only.
40% reduction in target lesion enhancement on MRI with AFP decrease from 3500 to 1200
Mild post-embolization syndrome resolved within 48 hours
Proceeding with planned cycle 3 TACE in 6 weeks
MRI liver and AFP prior to next TACE
